titleInfo.title: LSU History Oral History Project: Faculty & Adminstrators
titleInfo.subTitle: Paul C. Young et al. oral history interview, 1980

name.description: Professor emeritus Paul C. Young was born in 1892 in White, Texas. He attended North Texas Normal College, Nashville Bible School, the University of Louisville, and Bowdoin College in Maine. He graduated cum laude in 1918 and began his career as a school teacher at Florida State College for Women (Florida State University). He served as an LSU psychology professor from 1925 to 1960. He died in 1991.

subject.topic: Louisiana State University and Agricultural and Mechanical College.--School of Music--Faculty.

mods.note: Louisiana State University Libraries Special Collections (http://www.lib.lsu.edu/special)
mods.accessCondition: Physical rights are retained by the LSU Libraries. Copyright is retained by the interviewee and heirs and Louisiana State University in accordance with U.S. copyright laws.

"E-mail lsudiglib@lsu.edu with questions or comments. See instructions for ordering reprints of this audio here: http://www.lib.lsu.edu/special/services/duplication.html Mention the ""Item number"" or ""Item URL"" in your request. "
mods.abstract: This interview was conducted with Paul Young and some former LSU Music School faculty and students. They discuss Music School faculty and performances in the 1920s and 1930s, the Baton Rouge Opera Association, the LSU band, and Huey Long's influence on both the band and Music School.
